intro: Iridorkis truncata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Iridorkis truncata prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
